data.description: Start Date: June 1, 2026Why an Internship with the Hilb Group?An internship with the Hilb Group offers students the opportunity to explore multiple career paths within a growing insurance brokerage. As a rapidly expanding organization, we provide hands-on learning experiences and exposure to real-world projects that support both personal and professional development.Interns work closely with experienced team members, gain insight into our business operations, and contribute to meaningful analytics initiatives for our benefits department. You will also have the opportunity to travel to our corporate office in Richmond, VA, where you’ll connect with fellow interns, network with company leaders, and participate in a volunteer event.This internship may lead to full-time employment opportunities upon graduation. We’re excited to help you grow with us!Key Responsibilities:Learn and utilize the agency management system to support employee benefits analysis, reporting, and client deliverablesDevelop a foundational understanding of the employee benefits industry, including health and welfare plans, compliance requirements, and carrier operationsSupport benefits analysts, service, and sales teams by shadowing client meetings and internal strategy discussionsAssist with data analysis, entry, and validation related to employee benefits plans, renewals, and client reportingCompile and maintain records, reports, and benefit plan documentation to support client service and compliance effortsSupport the PCORI project and other regulatory and compliance-related initiatives within the benefits practiceResearch and analyze employee benefits data files for group clients, identifying trends, discrepancies, and opportunitiesGain exposure to the clients we serve and the industries they operate in, with an emphasis on benefits strategy and cost managementLearn about benefits carriers and vendors, including plan structures, funding arrangements, and reporting requirementsBuild an understanding of key employee benefits coverages and how they are applied to meet client needs and objectives Qualifications:Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree programPreferred majors include, Risk Management & Insurance, Acturarial Science, Mathematics, Business Management, or related fieldsProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, and PowerPointStrong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple prioritiesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsCurious, motivated, and eager to learn about the insurance industry and grow professionallyThe Hilb Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we actively support and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws prohibiting all forms of discrimination in employment. Additionally, we have a zero-tolerance policy for all forms of harassment in violation of federal, state, and local laws.
requirements: Develop a foundational understanding of the employee benefits industry, including health and welfare plans, compliance requirements, and carrier operations
Learn about benefits carriers and vendors, including plan structures, funding arrangements, and reporting requirements
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program
